use_cases_desc:
Different content mirroring applications (multiple tablets to central TV).
Collaborative Browsing (in the home), related to travel search tasks by Merry Morris
Findings about: cumulative viewing, cumulative co-viewing
evaluation: User study (qualitative); User study (quantitative, controlled lab experiment)
contribution_desc: Study about the sharing behaviour during collaborative search (i.e., travel planning) task in the home. Three tablets, with one single shared TV. Focus on Screen Mirroring.
crossdevice_def:
Focus on screen mirroring:

"Screen mirroring (also screen {sharing, casting, annexing}) is not a new concept, having first been demonstrated by Doug Englebart in 1968 [4] as a tool for remote collaboration."
[...] "A recent NPD survey [12] of smartphone users found a 40% awareness of the existence of screen-mirroring capabilities, with only 7% having ever used such features. Of these individuals, 75% had used this capability for mirroring videos, whilst approximately 50% had mirrored photos. "
